intro: Calceolaria engleriana subsp. engleriana, commonly known as the Engler's slipper orchid, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically orange or red in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes.
